settings.style: cinematic, documentary-style realism, soft lighting, multicultural atmosphere

prompts.text: People across the world — in cities, villages, mountains — look up at the sky filled with glowing golden lights. Faces show awe, fear, and wonder. A global moment of awakening.
A montage of TV screens showing major news networks (CNN, BBC, NHK, Al Jazeera) covering the phenomenon of golden lights. Anchors, scientists, and priests offer conflicting explanations.
Groups of people sit at kitchen tables, in mosques, churches, synagogues, and public parks. They debate, pray, or comfort one another, struggling to understand the events.
Crowds gather peacefully: some holding candles and praying, others with protest signs warning against alien influence. The atmosphere is tense but non-violent.
A golden light floats above a city square, displaying glowing universal symbols and messages in many languages. People stop to watch, some recording with their phones.
In various regions — Africa, Asia, Europe — small groups step into floating portals or board shimmering Anari vessels. Expressions show hesitation and hope.
Sarah, Aida, Daryl, Father Martinez, and Miriam stand together on a hillside, watching golden lights descend around the globe. Their faces reflect pride, sadness, and conviction.
Close-up of the main group’s faces — eyes forward, jaws clenched, tears in some eyes — as they step into a radiant field of light. This is the moment of irreversible change.
